docs.lead_paragraph: MY GOOD GREEN PLACE BY LEON EDEL Leon Edel's most recent book is ''Stuff of Sleep and Dreams: Experiments in Literary Psychology''; he is completing his autobiography, also to be published by Harper & Row. awake to a dazzling sun that turns my louvers to pinpoints of diamond-light. A blue sky, some fluffy clouds; the fragrance drifting in tells me that during a night of deep sleep there has been quiet rain. The trades aren't blowing today. Everything is motionless, unwilling to stir - silent except for the punctuation every now and again of certain musical notes, the most characteristic morning sounds in Hawaii. The small gray doves are at their lovemaking - tu-pa-pau, tu-pa-pau - all visitors to the islands, if they can carry a tune, go away with those notes inscribed in their ears.
